Reviews.Title: “Untrained Housekeeper kept this hotel from getting a 5 star from me. Otherwise Great.”
Reviews.Author: azstampcoin
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels to stay at and we stay in hotels far more often than in our own home. I work late into the morning. Went to bed at 5:30am and the housekeeper knocked on our door early even though we had a do not disturb sign posted on the door. I sincerely hope that this is just a case of a poorly trained housekeeper and not a directive from management. Housekeeper did not speak English when I tried to question why she knocked. Otherwise.....I love this place. Free food and beer for dinner. The most amazing breakfast buffet of any of the chain hotels in America. They had fresh fruit aplenty, cans of V8 juice, lots of yogurt types including Activia, Breakfast bars, Eggs, Meat, Waffles, and tons of other stuff much of which is never seen at a hotel free buffet. They also have a large pantry with lots of fairly priced, make that low-priced items. Room was a huge suite with bedroom separate from living area. Two big flat screen TV's with lots of channels. Full kitchen. Nice very large desk and nice chair. Fold-out bed. Plenty of well-lit free parking. Lots of food choices nearby. Too bad that housekeeper cost the hotel a 5 star rating. We'll come back though. Hopefully this review is noted by management and the housekeeping staff is retrained so I can sleep next time.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: halpin1567
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Staybridge. This stay we booked the 2 bedroom suite. It was very roomy which is nice when traveling with 3 children. The location is nice. They serve an awesome breakfast with a large variety. The only thing we did not like was there are no DVD Players in the bedroom. The staff is very friendly even in passing. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Okay location, but great service!”
Reviews.Author: bsu1999
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the hotel, the check-in guy informed me that since we booked through Priceline.com we were put in a smoking room with a king bed. I immediately asked him to switch me to a non-smoking room with either two beds or one bed + a roll-away or sofa sleeper. He agreed to do it without any trouble, but suggested for future stays to call ahead and ask about the accommodations and pre-arrange the room. The hotel offers free meals in the afternoon midweek, with food and beverages (including beer) free of charge. The room had a full size fridge and microwave, a small stovetop, a toaster oven, etc. I liked how the bathroom was separate from the sink area, although the bathroom was very small. The beds were just okay, but after a big meal and few drinks at Cheeseburger Paradise next door... it was just fine. It was also nice to have the living room separate from the bedroom area. Other amenities of mention: -The hottub was nice, although the jets were pretty week. If you're into lap swimming, you could appreciate the lane built into the swimming pool area. -The fitness center was small, but you get into Lifetime Fitness just down the road free of charge with your room key. -Breakfast was very good. I was able to make breakfast burritos, enjoy some fresh fruit, and make my own waffle... all free of charge. They have plenty of milks, coffees, teas, juices, and fountain drinks available as well. The only hiccup we had was when the fridge woke us up at 8am. It was obviously going out and sounded as if a jack hammer was secretly thrown into it as a cruel prank to wake us up. I called, and within no time, they had brought a new full size fridge up and quickly replaced it.

Reviews.Title: “Totally enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: itsallgoodnow2
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at this property and will stay there again whenever in the area. I worked with Kim in the sales office setting up our group with 85+ room booked with them at the time of our stay. Kim helped me out from the very start until after check out with attention to every small detail. No question was too small or too insignificant to answer. I found nothing but courtesty and promptness in dealing with the staff. I had some special requests for some of the VIP's staying with our group and they were happy to accomodate them. The hotel was fully booked and was kept maintained from all I observed. There were many small touches that were helpful to our group, with directions in the lobby to the venue for us and opening the breakfast buffet early so we were able to eat before leaving for our event. High marks to the staff of Staybridge Suites-Fishers!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again will I stay at a Staybridge”
Reviews.Author: Julie C
Reviews.Content: We ordered a non-smoking room and didn't get one. The hotel was sold out so we were told we couldn't change rooms. They tried an ozone cleaning technique that did NOT help. We opened the sofa bed and the top sheet had confetti all over it. Our daughter found a cardboard blow horn in her pillowcase. We were given new sheets. When we checked out they read our comment card about the poor service and said ABSOLUTELY nothing to us! I will be contacting our hockey tournament representatives and recommending that they take this hotel off the list of selections!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jamesanthony77
Reviews.Content: Best evening and morning staff. Great hotel. Andy is the best front desk person. Wonderfull stay and great folks. Great breakfast. Great manager sundowner.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Moms Night Out!”
Reviews.Author: Happywife06
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Our mommy group booked a suite for our annual retreat. We had a two bedroom two bath suite. The rooms were clean. The amenities were great. A BIG shout out to the manager and entire staff for making room for us during a very busy weekend. Highly recommend this location to families and, of course, moms who need a quick getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying again...”
Reviews.Author: dyl-icious
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed in this particular Staybridge, and I won't be staying there again. My business associate and I have been traveling for work for the past 4 months, staying in hotels every night and will continue to do so until next June. Cons: -We booked a non-smoking two bedroom suite over two months before our stay. We were assured that the request would be fulfilled. We called twice over the past two months to adjust the day of our departure and again asked that we have a non-smoking room... upon checking-in we were given a smoking room that smelled like Satan's ashtray. We asked to be moved but they would not accomodate the request. -We called the front desk and asked that the room be "ozoned" on a day that we were out on business. If they did it, it didn't help. There were no signs that any adjustments had been made in the room. Nothing like having luggage that smells like a ciggarette butt. -The wireless internet is HORRIBLE... at least in our room. We spoke to the manager about the problem and he claimed that it was an issue on our computers (we had three computers with us, none of which were able to connect to the internet for the duration of the stay). The manager gave us a tech support phone number, which we called twice. After spending well over two hours with the tech support, we found out that they could not remotely access the wireless routers in the hotel, leading them to believe that the problem wasn't our computers, rather it was the machines in the hotel. One nice worker did reset the routers, which worked for about an hour... and then went down again. It was a total drag... they advertize included high-speed internet...but you can never be sure. -The whole hotel just needs some updating. The wallpaper on our floor was coming apart a tthe seams. Both toilets in our hotel room were broken. Pros: -One of the better hotel breakfasts that we have had in the past couple of months. Not that the food was any better than any other place, but there was an ample supply, and the space was very clean. -The staff, for the most part, is quite nice. Though they weren't always able to help or accomodate us, they were pleasant to speak with. -Big parking lot. -Flat screen tvs to hook our computers up to via HDMI cable.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to have stumbled upon Staybridge Suites Fishers”
Reviews.Author: PENNY L
Reviews.Content: It is Sept 21, 2011 and I want to let people know that if they are going to be coming to Indianapolis (north east side) and they need a great hotel, this is it!!! My daughter and I have been in this hotel for 5 days, and it has been a very pleasant experience. My daughter has a life threatening medical condition and we drove from Columbus, Ohio for an (approx 30 day medical treatment at the Community hospital of Indianapolis). I was very nervous about coming to a city (I've never been to before) and having to stay for 30 days. The worry I had was that I would have to rent an apartment (to save on $$$) since it was a month long commitment for the medical procedure. I talked to various people at the hospital, about where we should stay for the month... everyone had a different opinion of where to stay. I researched the local hotels (I wanted one that was close to the hospial and it also had to be easily accessible to the freeway.) Well, I am very happy with the accomodations (studio with stovetop, frig, microwave, toaster, toaster oven along with pots and pans, silverwear, towels, and dishsoap too!) Free parking, free hot breakfasts, 3 free dinners at the hotel per week, free laudry room, free fitness center, free internet/business center with computers, faxes and printers. I haven't been in the pool or hot tub yet, but a fellow traveler told me this morning that she swam last night and it was lovely. We are going to extend our stay for the remaining 25 days. This is my first experience with Staybridge suites, but it won't be my last! Thank you for being here for us as we go through this difficult time. P.S. Three of the staff members have been extremely kind and helpful (Pam, Charles, and Kenny) Penny and Gabi (Columbus, Ohio)

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: moe_moe_0069
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel, the only negative thing I have to say is the housekeeping... The day we were checking out, the housekeeping came 2 times to "check" to see if we left yet. The check out time for this hotel was 12(noon). They came at 10:30 and 11 am! Neither of the ladies that came could speak English either... The rooms were awesome and the food was great. The complimentary breakfast was more like a buffet. We booked this hotel on hotwire.com and didn't see the hotels name first. But overall I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: aggie8967
Reviews.Content: Paid only 50 bucks from Priceline and the rooms were clean and bed was comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Functional, comfortable and extremely pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan42
Reviews.Content: I really like frills and extras. The Staybridge Suites in Fishers, Indiana did not cater to my every need and did not fulfill my every desire for hotel lodging and yet I was happy that I stayed there and here are a few of of my reasons. Space: The hotel is big and that means greater comfort. The pool was available and not full of kids every time I wanted a swim. You don't bump into someone every time you turn around and the staff is freed up to assist you should you require it. Comfort: The room is not huge and was not a suite in the traditional sense. It was more like a studio apartment. One room with a kitchenette (full fridge, stove, sink, dishes, dishwasher, microwave, toaster oven...) Great for the person contemplating a longer stay. Small bathtub but good shower head. Nice towels. Queen sized bed which was fine, good linens. The pillows are the worst, and they give you lots of them so one might be tempted to either view this situation as the glass being half empty or half full. Is having lots of bad pillows better than having too few? All I can say is that I learned long ago that if you want to avoid pillow issues, bring your own. The room had a couch and a good desk with plenty of lighting and plugs. Free WiFi. Good WiFi as well. The fixtures in the room were a mish-mash of styles but that was a nice break from the homogenous decor you find in most hotels. It was comfortable, it felt like my own apartment, my own private place of refuge in a place far from home. Nice flat screen television with good selection of cable channels. A DVD player was hooked up to the TV and you can rent DVD's at the business center. Abundant free parking is available. In the courtyard of the hotel are grills.. yes, cooking grills. You can buy some burgers or a steak and cook it up yourself. There is an enclosed outdoor basketball court in the back. The pool was very nice with separate whirlpool and large swim area with lap lane. Clean towels are abundant at the pool and in the room. The room and the hallways were very clean. My major complaint is that smoking rooms are scattered about each floor of the building and if there are smokers checked in, you are likely to get a strong whiff of their presence in the hallway. In many ways it is an unremarkable hotel except for the extremely pleasant staff, the ease of access to all facets of the hotel, the complimentary coffee and beverages. The small amenities and thoughtful details which make up for luxurious facades. The Staybridge is not high class, it is solid comfort.

Reviews.Title: “I have found a great value”
Reviews.Author: mom71
Reviews.Content: Between the ample free breakfast and the sparkling clean room this hotel would be worth the price. When you add in the free dinner (they call it a reception) every Tue.-Thur. night it becomes an amazing value. The night my mom and children and I were there they served hot dogs and hamburgers right off the grill! I really didn't expect much, I mean they were free, but I was very surprised when they were wonderful and accompanied by potato salad, a salad bar, desserts, other sides and the free beer and wine. Yes, free beer and wine! Amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: sonofposeidon
Reviews.Content: I would give this hotel 3.5 stars if I could, but as that's not possible and my wife liked it more than I did I'll give it four stars. It's located near many chain restaurants in the northeastern part of the Indianapolis area and is designed like a studio apartment; the fridge was convenient, as was the tableware and so forth. There are only two reasons why I hesitated to give it four stars: it's not as nice as Residence Inn, one of the chain's main competitors, and our queen bed seemed to have sheets designed for a smaller model. That being said, my wife was very pleased with it, and I have no real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME STAY!”
Reviews.Author: jacquejchristman
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone with a family. This was our first time at a staybridge and definitely wont be our last. Everything about our stay was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: louisvillefan2009
Reviews.Content: Was there the weekend of March 18-March 20 with wrestkers as well. The hotel was very clean and the employees were so wonderful and helpful with all requests. The breakfast was such as plus

Reviews.Title: “Not Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: javila3
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for three people, when we got to the hotel we were told there was only one queen bed and a couch. We were dumbfounded. We asked to get a room with 2 beds (any hotel that is 3 stars would have accomodated us) I finally asked to speak to the GM who proceeded to tell me I had 2 options 1. take their room or 2. LEAVE. He was incredibly rude. We had already paid for 14 nights. On the 4th night we find there are ants everywhere. I wouldn't reccommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rainbowboss
Reviews.Content: Very nice place for short stay or extended stay. Good service, Comfortable rooms, Great breakfasts, Great location somewhat outside of Indianapolis in suburb of Fishers. Full amenitiy list incl. health facilities, indoor pool, Free Internet. Free full breakfasts, Local paper to read in lobby. Sometimes hotel hosts large groups of young kids for sports competition - could be noisy on some floors. Also avoid 1st floor rooms unless you want to be near indoor pool and workout facilities. You need to request weekend towel service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 3* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LCFTAK
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. The staff was very friendly. Rooms were huge with full kitchen, living room and large bathroom. They were also spotless clean. The location is good and easy, right off the highway then a quick right. The hotel has a nice pool, fitness room and little convinience store in the lobby. It is right next door to the Cheeseburgers in Paradise restaurant. This hotel had the best free breakfast I have ever had with lots of hot and cold options. They even had a soda fountain, which was a big plus in my eyes. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Balance of Charm and Utility”
Reviews.Author: illyblc
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Staybridge Suites every time I visit Indianapolis, usually once or twice a year. The rooms have always been spotlessly clean with extremely comfortable beds and bedding and great showers. Even the smallest room has enough space to spread out and make oneself at home, making it an ideal place for long stays and a fairly luxurious one for short stays. They have an excellent pool and hot tub, and a great though compact 24-hour fitness center. The variety of complimentary hot breakfasts are an extremely welcome change from the usual muffin and bagel "continental" fare. The staff here are super-friendly and helpful. During my last stay, I asked to be moved up from the first floor to a room on a higher floor. I think I had my new room key before I even finished explaining my reasons. Also, the staff seemed to be on a first name basis with a lot of regular guests, which looked like a nice element of familiarity for business travelers. Altogether, this is an excellent hotel in a very convenient location. The rooms are tasteful and comfortable, the facilities are well cared for, and the people are great.

Reviews.Title: “CRIMINAL ACTIVITY BY EMPLOYEES!!!”
Reviews.Author: Diner480
Reviews.Content: When checking in to this hotel on 1-14-11 the front desk employee told me it is hotel policy to photo copy my credit card and drivers license to put in my hotel "profile" and that all my information would be destroyed once I check out. I thought this was a little shady, but agreed. I had already paid for my room through Priceline. Within in a few hours of checking in someone tried charging my credit card for $701 at Western Union. The ONLY time my credit card has been out of my hand was when I checked in. I would stay away from this hotel!! Thankfully I had given them my credit card and not a debit card or my bank account would of been drained within a couple hours! Luckily my credit card contacted me as soon as the person tried using my card number at Western Union to warn me of the fraudulent activity. Either the front desk person is personally stealing guests credit card information or saving the photo copies to pass off to other people to use. BEWARE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for 1 night or 111 nights!”
Reviews.Author: jesstoday
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate through Priceline & was lucky enough to get this hotel! We were there for 2 nights for the UFC fights in Indy & stayed in room 421. Check in was fast, friendly & quick. Rooms had everything you could want as a home away from home. Nice size room with big bed & pull out couch. Sink area separate from shower/toilet. Kitchen area had full fridge with ice maker in freezer, stove top with 2 elements, dishwasher, toaster, toaster oven, microwave, full set of dishes as well as pots/pans & cutlery. Bed was firm but nice & bedding was soft & good quality. Big flat screen TV swivelled to any angle & free high speed internet came in handy. Didn’t get to use pool/hot tub/gym but areas looked nice & clean. Breakfast I wanted to mention separate because this was no ‘dry pastry crap coffee old apples’ continental thing, it was a full breakfast! Yummy pancakes & Belgian waffles, hot eggs, bacon along with fresh fruit, yogurt, breads, etc! Lots of drinks, different coffees, juices, sodas, milk & tea. I was impressed. The only thing that bothered me was that this hotel is pet friendly, which itself is great, but they need to develop a way to keep them away from other guests. Having a barking dog across the hall from our room was NOT acceptable. Pet owners should be considerate of those who have NOT learned to tune your dog out when barking incessantly for hours. If it wasn’t for that, the hotel would have got an excellent from me! Seemed nicer than a 2 ½ or 3 star as stated, plus with the money you save eating in & all the extras that come free with this Staybridge, this is an amazing hotel! :) Tip for out of state/country travellers: Indiana is a dry state on Sunday! No alcohol at all so we had to buy it passing through Michigan where it was more expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great stay. Very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: AmericanExplorer8500
Reviews.Content: Everything is great here. Loved the rooms with windows that open. Spacious rooms with many convienences. Nice towels and linens. Friendly staff. Clean pool with clean hot tub. Good breakfast with waffles, yummy. Will return to this or any Staybridge now. I did not know they were so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Staybridge Hotel I've Ever Seen”
Reviews.Author: DallasJackson57
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, I couldn’t help but notice the hallways were hot and smelled of terrible body odor. The carpet is tattered in the hallways and in my room. My toilet would not flush so I went to the front desk the next morning to report it for maintenance. I then ate breakfast but wish I hadn’t. The coffee was empty as was the egg tray. When I asked if there would be more eggs, I was told, “you have to wait!” Apparently, I wasn’t the first to inquire. That night I returned to my room and found the toilet still would not flush. I reported it to the front desk again the next morning and they assured me it would be fixed immediately. When I returned for the third night, the toilet still would not flush!! I finally checked out and told them about the broken toilet again out of courtesy for the next guest. The desk clerk didn’t even write it down so I’m guessing it never got fixed. Life is too short to waste your time in this DUMP.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: MyValentine2004
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Staybridge Suites during a recent visit to Indiana to do some hiking. We were pleased with the service and accommodations. When we arrived on Friday night we found the parking lot completely full- there were no spots at all! We basically staked out the parking lot until a spot opened up. But, even with a full hotel, the front desk attendants always recognized us and were very friendly. I appreciated that we had the option to decline housekeeping services- I don’t feel the need to have daily service, especially for short stays. There’s a small convenience shop located in the lobby of the hotel with reasonably priced snacks, soda and necessities. Our room was spacious and clean. It included a DVD player and windows that open. The sink and mirror is separate from the toilet and bath, which I like. The pool/spa area is very nice- the spa is large and there is a lap lane in the pool, which is very nice! All in all, we had a very nice visit and would return.

Reviews.Title: “wow! we were impressed!”
Reviews.Author: travelgal143
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Staybridge suites while visiting some attractions in Indianapolis. We had a nice small suite with full kitchen. Coffee, tea and microwave popcorn were provided. Evening buffett and hot breakfast were provided, nice indoor pool and hot tub. There were grills outside for guest use and basketball courts. Pleasant indoor and outdoor seating. Room was clean, nicely decorated and roomy. Hallway noise was a bit of a problem, but I now travel with a white noise machine that covered most of it up. All staff members were friendly and helpful. My only complaint was that it seemed to be in need of some updating. There were several areas of the hallway carpet worn bare and a hole in the upholstry of the sofa in our room. We did book our room through hotwire and I think in general we get older rooms that way. All in all, for the price we paid we were thrilled and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: seacruiser1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was assigned to us on a Priceline bid. What a wonderful experience it turned out to be! We arrived on a Tuesday and departed on a Saturday. I mention this because during the week there were more business guests and over the weekend the families prevailed. The breakfasts were above our expectations and we were surprised to find that Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays they have complimentary dinners during their sundowners buffets. They also had free beer and wine.. I'm not a drinker but I did enjoy the quality coffee that is always available. Our suite was clean and roomy with a separate bedroom and living / kitchen area. Staff was very courteous!

Reviews.Title: “Is there a Staybridge Suites there”
Reviews.Author: CSIFortRiley
Reviews.Content: With the many hotels I stay in for my work I really enjoyed the cleanliness and wonderful staff that made this stay one that makes you first asking is there a Staybridge Suites were I am going.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for traveling with pet”
Reviews.Author: starshine68
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable relaxing stay. The staff was friendly and professional. We did not make a reservation and received a ground floor room as requested with quick service. The room was nice it was a little well worn but quite clean. We enjoyed the pool and it seemed well cared for as well.

Reviews.Title: “Ambiance-free, but big suites”
Reviews.Author: kcliss
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults, 2 children under 10) stayed in a 2-bedroom suite. Plenty of room for everyone at a good rate. We liked the pool and hot tub, included breakfast, large suite. Some negatives: our room was on the highway side, and, while it's pretty well sound-insulated, at night we could hear the traffic. Turning on the HVAC fan helped, but it's located in the second bedroom, so is a bit loud in itself. Staff was helpful, breakfast was decent; we had no trouble, but I can imagine that on a busy weekend it'd be hard to find a seat. This is a long way from downtown, and the only dining options are chains. Mind you, there are a lot of 'em around the area, but I highly recommend taking the short drive to Broadripple to dine in more honest surroundings. Also, if character in lodging is important, there's nothing around here that will fit the bill. If the people we were visiting weren't close by, we'd be staying much closer to downtown Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities, but beware of overbooking”
Reviews.Author: sweetergirl
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations for this hotel based on this site’s numerous glowing reviews. Although our overall experience was satisfactory, we were disappointed by the unwelcome news we received at check-in. We arrived shortly after check-in following a 5-hour road trip and were greeted with the news that the hotel was "oversold" and there was no room available for us. When I asked how that was possible when we had a reservation guaranteed with a credit card, the woman at the front desk explained that they were overbooked, "like the airlines". This is something I have never encountered at any other hotel. I can understand a business' need to maximize profits in a depressed economy, but to do so at the expense of loyal customers (we are Priority Club members) with reservations just seems foolish. And, as you can imagine, this was not welcome news to a family consisting of a tired three-year-old, his pregnant mother, and frazzled father. Ultimately we were able to persuade the front desk person to give us a room and we were glad we’d stood our ground! We stayed in a studio suite and we found it perfect for our family of three. We loved the down pillows, HDTV, in-room kitchen, and sleeper sofa. The room did show signs of wear, though, including holes in the sofa upholstery and draperies and deep scratches on the bathroom door and toilet seat. We really enjoyed the hotel's breakfast buffet and the Sundowner Reception, too. These were nicely done with plenty of options; definitely a step up from your average hotel breakfast. Seating was tight at times, but we were happy to take our food and drink back to the room. I would stay here again based on the amenities, but I’m not sure I’d risk the possibility of being greeted with, “We’re oversold”.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor does it again!”
Reviews.Author: FL2007
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor is my first stop when planning a trip and once again the review information did not lead me astray. Everything is just as written in previous reviews plus currently they are offering free meals and drinks during the week. We arrived on our way through Indianapolis on a trip and didn't leave the hotel until after a great breakfast. The staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: gltravelerIl
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based upon reviews from other travelers here on Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed at all. We had a two-bedroom suite (queen, double/double) and it was more than roomy. I was shocked and pleased to find out there were two bathrooms and three tv's. The small kitchen had a fridge, stove, microwave, toaster oven, toaster, coffee maker, etc. - everything you would need to have a meal in your room. The room was laid out so the common area with table and chairs and sofa separated the two bedrooms so you have a real sense of privacy. Everything was extremely clean and attractive. The common areas of the hotel were all attractive and exceptionally clean. The courtyard was especially beautiful at this time of year with all the blooming flowers and landscaping. Front desk personnel were friendly and helpful. A very pleasant experience - would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: babe199
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Fantastic place. Very clean and modern. Rooms are amazing. Small kitchen area with microwave, fridge, and dishwasher. Area for sitting and a great Bathroom. In the evening for 1.5 hours they provide free food and drink ( including alcohol). Breakfast is also included. Hot and cold food.There are also free facilities for doing your own laundry! Very close the centre. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: pragmaticgirl
Reviews.Content: When I arrived it was about 8:30 PM. I requested an upgrade to my room (as a platinum member it's one of the perks), When I got the one bedroom suite it had only one King size bed. Since I was there with my sister I requested a room with two doubles. There was nothing available. Linda the receptionist was great, she gave us a two bedroom suite and we were thrilled. The suite was fantastic: two bedrooms with a queen bed in one and two doubles in the other, full kitchen, dining area, both bedrooms with own bathroom and TV and flatscreen TV in living area with pull out couch. The furniture is not the cheap stuff either that you usually find in t hotel at this price. The breakfast was amazing, lots of hot food, waffles, bacon etc and to go bags if you were in a rush. There was also an event called the sundown reception where you could eat and drink free Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday night. We're not talking appetisers here, there was barbque one night, cheeseburger in paradise another night and oriental the third night, oh and free beer and wine also (draft beer). I have never stayed an a hotel that had so much put on for the guests (for Free). There were three computers in the business room and free internet access, a fax, copier and printer were available also (again free). Laundry facilities were incredible, four washers and dryers so you didn't have to wait (free). We stayed through the indy 500 weekend (memorial weekend) and although the hotel was full there was no noise or trouble, the grounds are tightly secured by Larry. The grounds at the back of the hotel are beautiful with tables and barbques (the gas kind) so you could cook also if you wanted. Don't even question the quality of this hotel. Some days the maids didn't leave enough shampoo but who cares, ask and you shall receive. We stayed in room 210. Also located by the I69 and shopping. Honors Beauty College is a short walk down the street, get a full facial for $25, it's fantastic. Cheeseburger in paradise is next door, so if you want a few cocktails just nit over, no driving that was a great perk, and a real carribean feel with outdoor dining. Don't go to Petersons it's a rip off....

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Updated, with a great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: JasonSed
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I got a great deal via h0twire and was not sure what the expect. It was clean, friendly, and nicely updated. The rooms were large and had a small kitchen area. Free internet in the room, a nice tv, and comfortable beds. The bathroom amenities were minimal, but fine. It was quiet and the location was good. Easy access down 96 to tons of restaurants and close a very nice mall. The breakfast was the best I have ever had in a hotel and was included in the price. Tons of selection and it was all very fresh. I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Snowwhatfun
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean. It did not show it's age of 10 years at all. Staff was friendly and helpful. Common areas were nice and pool was great. Continental breakfast way above average.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: patelms1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed there the night before my wedding. The room was great and there was more than enough room. We got a 2 bedroom suite. There were 5 adults, 1 child, and 1 16 month old. I was very happy with their service and the free breakfast was marvelous. If not for that, I probably wouldn't have eaten anything that morning. They let me do a late checkout because my wedding was at 10:30 in the morning about 45 minutes away. Anyway, while we were packing after the wedding, my new watch was left behind in my watch case. I called them a few times and they were extremely patient with me, as I'm sure that I was frantic. They found it and I was able to pick it up. It was such a relief as it was a present. The staff was so friendly and accomodating. The beds were extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: ILHawkeye
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here! Property was beautiful with flowers and cleanliness. Staff was very friendly. Our room had two bedrooms and was great with our children with us. We had three tv's in the room! Happy hour our first nite was a cookout with hamburgers, hotdogs and chicken....amazing! Look no further than here to stay! We are very picky about where we stay and this was the best ever! Great job Staybridge!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: prestomac
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few weeks back, but thought I should write on it......I had a great time at this hotel. The rooms were modern and spectacular. I felt right at home. I will try to stay at a staybridge suites whenever i can now, and I travel A LOT.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Johninchicago
Reviews.Content: So, we selected this hotel based on the "pet friendly" designation, and the always helpful reviews listed on this site. We booked through their website and had an easy check-in. At the last minute, we found someone to watch our pets and considered cancelling our reservation in order to stay elsewhere, but decided to try it out, and we weren't disappointed. The hotel was very clean, the staff was very helpful, and the breakfast was excellent. We had no complaints, and despite our initial reservations concerning booking an "extended stay" hotel (which conjured images of people drying laundry from clotheslines across balconies and unsupervised children throwing rocks at cars in the parking lot), the hotel was among the nicest, cleanest, and conveniently located hotels we've stayed in. The high points? The breakfast selection was changed subtly each morning. Jimmy Buffet's burger joint is next door, and has good bar food and is open late. Easy access to the freeway. A stocked business center. Free high speed internet in the room. An apartment- sized fridge with an icemaker, and a full size microwave- so you can have your scotch over ice and warm up your leftovers from the burger place next door at 3 am if you want. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was a pleasure staying here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hammer8106
Reviews.Content: Hello! I just wanted to express how much we enjoyed staying at the Staybridge Suites in Fishers, IN. We were there watching my son at the NCAA Division III Mens Golf Championship. My parents were there with me and we were thrilled with the living arrangements in having the 2 bedrooms and a living room/kitchen accommodations. It made our stay for the week very comfortable and the costs were similar to any other hotel and having 2 rooms---but this was so much better. The computer room with 3 computers available was amazing and the complimentary washer & dryers were a plus!!! The breakfasts were amazing and so much better than the usual complimentary breakfast you get at most hotels. The selections were different each day and very tasty!!!! One special thanks to Wayne at the front desk who was exceptionally cheerful and very helpful to us!!! Thanks again for making our visit to Indiana a great one!!! We are definitely staying at Staybridge Suites in our future travels!!!! Hopefully more will be available in the U.S.!!

Reviews.Title: “Sadly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Gill68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with the main purpose of our visit being the Indy 500. Chose the hotel based on previous reviews. First the positives - The hotel location is good, accessible to main routes A number of good restaurants nearby. Breakfast is reasonably good with decent selection of food Fully equipped kitchen in each suite Business services, inc internet were not busy and could be easily accessed. Laundry machines were free of charge Unfortunately this was offset by a number of negatives - We booked, and paid for, a king size suite. There is no way it was a king size bed. Reception staff insisted it was, stating maybe it seems small but it's king size. I asked to view another room to confirm but this request was refused, claiming the hotel was full and would be throughout our stay. There was no table and chairs to use for dining in the room. This enquiry was greeted with a suggestion that we sit on the sofa and use the coffee table. Apparently not all rooms have a dining table? - What's the point of a fully equipped kitchen if ou have to sit at the coffee table or the workstation desk? On Saturday and Sunday mornings staff seemed unable to cope with the numbers of people of breakfast. Basic items such as milk were not being replenished quickly. Standard housekeeping is bed making, trash removal and towel replenishment Monday to Friday, any other cleaning such as vacuuming, bathroom cleaning is only done on a weekly basis. Upon check in I was informed that weekend standard housekeeping was by request only. Well at almost $200 per night (presumably loaded due to the race) for the weekend rates I don't expect to make my own bed and do without fresh towels so I requested it. It was also pointed out that this was a holiday weekend. Nevertheless I stuck to my guns and we did receive weekend housekeeping. All in all we were disappointed. It's a decent enough hotel at the standard rate (we paid $116 per night apart from race weekend) however I'm left with a definite feeling that room 429 was not the king size suite we paid for and the staff did nothing to convnce me otherwise. Next tme I think we'll try the Residence Inn next door.

Reviews.Title: “Stay there a lot, but.....”
Reviews.Author: JLFitzfamily
Reviews.Content: We have 4 children, and given the fire laws in Indy along with the fact that we haven't found a hotel that can "guarantee" adjoining rooms...this is about our only option. It's a nice property and conveniently located and has a convenience type store on site. It's definately geared towards families! Continuous problems are....the pool is ALWAYS to cold and never supervised. So if you don't mind 5 - 10 year olds alone in the pool with you doing WHATEVER they want (since the parents are no where in site)and we've never seen any monitoring by hotel staff. In fact the 2nd to the last time we were there some guests had 2 dogs in the pool! In addition, there's never sufficient food or staff at the breakfast buffet for the guests (or trays/silver ware/glasses/etc.) - our last visit we had to wait over 45 minutes just to get a bagel & you better meet the delivery truck at the front door if you want a paper, the beds are very hard (bring your own mattress topper and pillows). The exercise room is "OK" if the equipment is working, but it's also part of the laundry room so be prepared to sweat if the dryers are on! But the laundry is free! The only provide shampoo (bargain basement) and soap (not too bad). If you want conditioner or hand cream or forgot a razor, don't expect to get one at the front desk...they'll direct you to the convenience store! There's only 2 elevators and they're TINY! Just enough room for a luggage cart and 2 people so don't check in or out when they're busy! The 2 room suites are very roomy, but be prepared to make the call to get light bulbs replaced or the stove or microwave fixed! Bring ear plugs for the 2nd bedroom since the heat pump is in the closet and it's LOUD! We'll stay there again since it's our only reasonable option in the area...but I hate paying for buffets, etc. that we really can't use.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well-kept and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Laramer
Reviews.Content: After reading positive reviews on Tripadvisor, we booked a 3 night stay over Labor Day weekend. We were not disappointed -- in fact we were incredibly pleased with the value and amenities of this hotel. The grounds were immaculately kept with lovely floral landscaping. The pool was clean and the rooms spotless. The breakfast buffet in the morning, free I might add, was terrific too. The make-your-own blueberry waffles were wonderful! The staff was friendly and we couldn't believe the size and quality of our suite for the price. Definitely the best hotel we've stayed at in Indy for the money. We'd never stay anywhere else again. Not a bad drive to the zoo, downtown or the race tracks. We definitely recommend Staybridge Suites in northern Indianapolis!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a nice area of Indy. The rooms are spacious and with full kitchens. Customer service was above average. Grounds were welcoming. Breakfast buffet was better than expected. There was a basketball camp staying at the hotel while we were there, but we did not have any negative effects from it. For me there were two negatives: The air conditioner was unusually loud and kept me from sleeping well, and the mattress and pillows were too soft causing back aches in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Best Suite Hotel that my family has stayed in”
Reviews.Author: newgirl1992
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in a 2bedroom/2bath suite on July 3rd 2006 for 1 night. I was very pleased with this hotel. The room was very clean and spacious, the kitchen area was great! It included a stove, microwave, fridge w/icemaker, dishwasher, toaster, coffeemaker and of course all the dishes that you needed. Each room had its own large television which was really nice. The living room also had a TV and VCR in its own armoir. The hotel was very quite but I forgot to follow one viewers comment and request a room away from the interstate. It was loud and annoying but I turned on the AC fan to run and that blocked the sound out. The courtyard was beautiful and relaxing. They have lots of patio tables and cushioned chairs out there and grills. They also will supply some of your grilling needs such as utensils etc at the front desk. The pool sits away from the hotel but is still connected (if that makes sense). I didn't swim but I did peek in. It is a good size pool and a decent hot tub.My husband thought the pool was dirty and cloudy and a liitle cold so I mentioned that on the comment card. The breakfast buffet was nice; they had a lot of choices such as fruitbars, fruit, bagles, donuts, cereal, waffles, eggs, hard boiled eggs, lots of juices and milks and softdrinks...a large variety. I should also mention that it looked like the hotel has a full basketball court outside..pretty neat! I really cannot say enough nice things about this hotel. I really do intend to stay at a staybridge when ever I can. This hotel is also off a main road that has a little of everything from shopping(EX Meijer, Kohls) to food places We went to the zoo ( which was really nice) and to the Childrens Museum ( Which was also very well liked by my chldren) and they are both about 15 min from the hotel. I Highly recommend eating next door to the hotel at Cheese Burger in Paradise.. Great food and alot of fun, our children loved the food and the live entertainment. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: MrLuckyPants
Reviews.Content: We took a family vacation to Indianapolis, and decided to stay in a one-bedroom suite at the Staybridge Suites in Fishers. It's nice to have a separate bedroom for the adults since we stay up a little later than our kids (ages 7 and 10). Check-in was fast and the staff was very professional. The rooms are very well furnished with fridge, microwave, toaster oven, dishwasher, coffee maker, etc. Although the hotel was full, we rarely heard any other guests, and then just barely. The breakfast buffet was nice. Each day was a little different -- scrambled eggs and sausage links, egg patties and ham with crescants, egg "McMuffins", scrambled eggs and bacon, etc. Plus, all of the usual offerings like hot waffles, donuts, cereal, toast, yogurt, fruit, milk & juice, coffee, and more. Tuesday through Thursday they have a "Sundowner Reception", which we assumed would be chips and drinks. We were very pleasantly surprised to find on Tuesday not only chips and drinks (wine, beer, soda), but meatballs, rolls, a creamed mushroom cap appetizer from a local restaurant, and more. Wednesday was grill night, and they had hot dogs & hamburgers. Both nights were full meals for our family. Plus, the hostess working the buffet was very friendly and courteous. The hotel is right next door to Cheeseburger in Paradise, a Jimmy Buffet / Key West themed restaurant. I heartily recommend it for burger lovers. They have very good onion rings too... I only have two minor complaints about our stay: - The pool was a little on the cool side, but not enough to keep us out. We've seen worse... - The air conditioning unit was in a locked closet in the bedroom, and was a little loud. On the whole, we were very happy with our stay at Staybridge Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: Travelingmaven
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Staybridge Suites, Indianapolis-Fishers, IN. and I wish I could have stayed longer! The hotel is everything one could want: clean, nicely decorated, great location near a number of freeways, restaurants, and malls, with a complimentary hot breakfast buffet daily (6:30 to 9 a.m.), business center and hi-speed internet hook-up in the suites. The suites are on the small side but stocked with tea, coffee, microwave popcorn, crystal stemmed glasses (!), and are quiet. The queen-size bed I had was comfortable, and best of all, the air conditioning/heating worked well, and didn't make a lot of noise. The hotel staff are incredibly friendly & helpful. What I really liked was that they gave me a card with my suite's direct telephone number to hand out if needed. I'd stay at this Staybride again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: julblaze
Reviews.Content: We thought this place was great. On Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, there is a manager's reception. There is enough there to make it a meal, including wine! Breakfast was good, and staff was friendly. Pool is nice. We had a suite which was great for traveling with children. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: moprep
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights this past week. I would have given this property an excellent were it not for the soft, back breaking beds. Rooms were comfortable, although the heat was a bit uneven. Living room fine, bedroom cold. As with most other Staybridge properties, breakfast was above average. Great location, as The Fishers, Carmel area is more upscale than other Indy suburbs in the best part of Indy area. One exit south on I-69 is 82nd St with tons of shopping, including Mall at Keystone Crossing, with Saks and even a Cheesecake Factory. Ask if front desk can call ahead to put you on a waiting list to save time. One exit north to 116th St is downtown Fishers where there is an Original Pancake House. Skip the hotel breakfast one time and treat yourself! Hotel is 25 minutes from Indy airport, and 20 minutes to downtown. I recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: SunnyTrvlLvr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on June 1, 2004. Chose this hotel due to proximity to concert venue (Verizon Wireless Music Center - Noblesville 7 miles) and availability of 2 bedroom suites (we were travelling with another couple). Positives: TV in each room, full size refrigerator, microwave, 2 burner cooktop, 2 bathrooms, free breakfast, happy hour, room size, indoor pool & whirlpool. Negatives: Living area (not bedrooms) smelled funny, probably due to kitchen facilities & related spills, etc or pet policy. One bathroom didn't have a cover on the overhead light. We would recommend this hotel and will stay there again if we're in the area. The front desk staff seemed genuinely concerned that we did not have a perfect stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Staybridge Suites Indianapolis - Fishers
HotelInfo.Address: 9780 Crosspoint Blvd, Indianapolis, IN 46256
